abstract: Defense Dept, prompted by 'accidental weapons discharge' by civilian outside recruiting center in Lancaster, Ohio, asks that armed civilians who have volunteered to stand guard outside military recruiting centers around country stand down; volunteer effort was initiated after mass shooting at recruiting station in Chattanooga, Tenn.
lead_paragraph: The Defense Department said that armed individuals volunteering to guard recruiting stations in the wake of the shooting in Chattanooga, Tenn., should leave their posts after a volunteer accidentally fired a weapon in Ohio.

headline.main: Defense Dept. Asks Armed Civilians to Stop Guarding Recruiters
headline.print_headline: Defense Dept. Asks Armed Civilians to Stop Guarding Recruiters

snippet: The Defense Department said that armed individuals volunteering to guard recruiting stations in the wake of the shooting in Chattanooga, Tenn., should leave their posts after a volunteer accidentally fired a weapon in Ohio.
